page.title: 10North Upottery:Roads,lanes.
page.content: This area is mostly one of tiny lanes;and very lovely they are,with tall hedges,whose ancient banks are covered in primroses,violets,bluebells and campion in the spring.However,the network of lanes connects up with a good road that runs from the A.30 near Honiton to Taunton through Upottery; and also with the main A.303 to London. The Taunton road is a well-surfaced country road,climbing through pretty scenery out of Upottery,skirting the beeches of Beacon Hill,then out on to the plateau.Traffic is very light. With the A.303 we have a love-hate relationship,especially in the summer-time,when it is choc-a-bloc with holiday-makers' cars and almost impossible to enter from our lanes.Its traffic blocks are frequent and make marketing trips a nightmare.
